bcid
Class bcid

java.lang.Object
  bcid.bcid

public class bcid
extends java.lang.Object

The bcid class encapsulates all of the information we know about a particular identifier, including the status of EZID creation, associated dataset calls, and any metadata. There are several ways to construct this class. Some of the constructors create a bcid representation out of the box and are meant to then use to pass onto the database so it can be created. Other constructors create a bcid by looking up in the database and populating the bcid class variables that way.

Constructor Summary
bcid(java.math.BigInteger identifiers_id, java.lang.String ark)
          Create a bcid by passing in an BigInteger for the specific slot in the database and a string representation of this ARK.
bcid(java.lang.Integer datasets_id)
          Create a bcid by passing in a single integer.
bcid(java.lang.String sourceID)
          Create a bcid given only a source identifier.
bcid(java.lang.String sourceID, int resourceTypeIdentifier)
          Create a bcid given a source identifier, and a resource type identifier
bcid(java.lang.String sourceID, java.net.URI webAddress)
          Create a bcid given a source identifier and a web address for resolution.
bcid(java.lang.String sourceID, java.net.URI webAddress, int resourceTypeIdentifier)
          Create a bcid given a source identifier, web address for resolution, and a resource type identifier
 
Method Summary

          Return JSON representation of this bcid

          Express this identifier as a row.

          Express this identifier in triple format

public bcid(java.lang.String sourceID,
            java.net.URI webAddress)
Create a bcid given a source identifier and a web address for resolution. The resource type identifier becomes simply "Resource"

bcid

public bcid(java.lang.String sourceID)
Create a bcid given only a source identifier. No web address redirection and the resource type will be simply "Resource"

Parameters:
sourceID -

bcid

public bcid(java.math.BigInteger identifiers_id,
            java.lang.String ark)
Create a bcid by passing in an BigInteger for the specific slot in the database and a string representation of this ARK. This class should probably only be instantiated by the resolver class, after it figures out what BigInteger a particular ARK belongs to.

Parameters:
identifiers_id - indicating the integer of this identifier in the BCID system
ark - is the Full identifier

bcid

public bcid(java.lang.Integer datasets_id)
Create a bcid by passing in a single integer. In this case, we assume this is simply a dataset.

Parameters:
datasets_id -
